availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Owingsville, Bath County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Taylor. Father of Ann E. Taylor, Lewis P. Taylor, William Z. Taylor, and Nannie Taylor. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Owingsville in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Owingsville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 1B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 74B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Precinct 6, p. 35.
